exchanges.content: Your problem statement is to calculate the revenues generated by Zomato. Please feel free to ask any clarifying questions before you begin.

whole India.

And after that, we would be taking in around the market share of the matter in this particular age group. And then In this question, we have to estimate the revenue on a normal day. using the frequency of orders of user,â€¦assuming that high frequency users usually orders 30 times in a month and a medium users, usually Orders, 15 times a month, and a low user usually orders for two â€“ three times a month. Start
exchanges.context: Candidate indicates to start the interview

exchanges.content: Your problem statement is that you have to calculate the total number of people that smoke cigarettes in delhi.
exchanges.context: Interviewer presents a guesstimate problem to the candidate

exchanges.content: So in this question are we considering any particular category of cigarettes?
exchanges.context: Clarifies the question

exchanges.content: Yes, calculate for tobacco cigarettes
exchanges.context: Interviewer randomly selects what he wants the candidate to focus on

exchanges.content: Do we have do consider cigarettes as preminum or cheap ones?
exchanges.context: Clarifies the question

exchanges.content: Calculate for premium
exchanges.context: Interviewer randomly selects what he wants the candidate to focus on

exchanges.content: So to tackle this problem, we would start with the delhi population of 2 crore
exchanges.context: To takle problem establised in step -1 starting by the population is always a good starting point since our answer would be subset of the overall population of delhi. hence as the candiate starts with this and states that the delhi population as 2 crores

exchanges.content: Alright.
exchanges.context: Candidate starting point is correct and the number stated is also correct

exchanges.content: Then i would be bifurcating delhi population on the basis of age
exchanges.context: Proceeds to narrow down the population of 2 crores established in step 1 by suggesting age as a specefic filter because proneness to smoking correlates to age

exchanges.content: Why do you do the age segmentation?
exchanges.context: Understands the logic presented and delebrately questions the assumptions presented

exchanges.content: I did the age segmentation because your prone to smoking a cigarette would be a factor of your age, since as your age increases people are less likely to smoke due to health, responsiblities etc.
exchanges.context: Provides a logical reason for using age as a specefic filter

exchanges.content: Ok, go on..
exchanges.context: Shows his agreement since the reason is logical

exchanges.content: 18 to 60 would be the targeted segment that will smoke
exchanges.context: Age is establised as a filter in step 3 so candidate chooses a particular age segment between 0 to 70 years.

exchanges.content: Why this particular target segment?
exchanges.context: Tests why did the candidate choose this particular segment to unserstand his reasnoning.

exchanges.content: So, because people under the age of 18, don't tend to smoke cigarettes as much and people above age of 60 are health conscious and their health restrictions force them to leave cigarettes.
exchanges.context: Provides a logical reason for choosing a specefic age segment to narrow down the population established in step 1

exchanges.content: Alright.
exchanges.context: Shows his agreement since the reason is logical

exchanges.content: Then further i would be dividing the age groups, 18 to 30 and 30 to 60.
exchanges.context: Divided the selected age segment establised in step 5 into two groups.

exchanges.content: Why did you specefically segment 18 to 60 into 2 buckets being 18 to 30 and 30 to 60
exchanges.context: Delibrately questions on why did the candidate segment like this to understand his reasoning.

exchanges.content: I did this because when a person is in the age group of 18 to 30, they are more prone to smoking cigereetes as they are healthy and have less respponsibilty while as there as their age increases they become more responsible and less healty hence a less percentage will be prone in older ages.
exchanges.context: Provides a logical reason for choosing the sub segments suggested in step 6

exchanges.content: Ok
exchanges.context: Shows his agreement since the reason is logical

exchanges.content: Now as stated since the delhi's population is 2 crore, since india is a young nation 40% of the population will fall in 18 to 30 while another 40% of the population will fall in 30 to 60, that will be 80 lakhs for both groups
exchanges.context: Proceeds to narrow down the population establised in step 1 into sub segments establised in step 7

exchanges.content: Alright.
exchanges.context: Shows his agreement since numbers assumed by the candidate are logical and the final numbers are correct for both age sub segments after calculations.

exchanges.content: And as stated in my assumption that the people smking in order ages will be less, i will be considering that 60% of the people in 18 to 30 and 40% of the people in 30 to 60 will be prone towards smoking, hence giving us 48 lakh and 32 lakh respectively.
exchanges.context: Calculates the population prone to smoking in each age sub segment

exchanges.content: Alright.
exchanges.context: Shows his agreement since numbers assumed by the candidate are logical and the final numbers are correct for both age sub segments after calculations.

exchanges.content: Hence a total of 80 lakh people are prone towards smoking
exchanges.context: Adds the numbers calculated in the step 9 and calculates a total.

exchanges.content: Ok
exchanges.context: Shows his validation.

exchanges.content: To further calculate the total no. of people actually smoking i will segment this 80 lakhs on the basis of gender.
exchanges.context: Proceeds to narrow down the population established in step 10 by suggesting gender as a specefic filter because proneness to smoking correlates to gender in india

exchanges.content: Why segmenting on the basis of gender relevent here?
exchanges.context: Delebrately tests why did the candidate do this gender segmentation to understand his reasoning.

exchanges.content: Since in india men seem to smoke more as compared to females.
exchanges.context: Provided a logical reason for using gender as a possible filter

exchanges.content: Alright go on.
exchanges.context: Shows agreement

exchanges.content: So considering a 50/50 split there would be 40 lakh males and 40 lakh females
exchanges.context: Proceeds to segment gender established in step 12 into two sub segments and calcuates the population in each sub segment

exchanges.content: Ok
exchanges.context: Shows his agreement since it looks logical

exchanges.content: Considering 60% of the men smoke cigarettes and 20% of the females smoke, we will get a total no. of 32 lakh smoking population.
exchanges.context: Proceeds to calcuate the smoking population in two sub segments established in step 13 and their total

exchanges.content: Ok
exchanges.context: Shows his agreement since the numbers are correct and logical

exchanges.content: And then, since this question we have to find out the number of people who smoke premium cigarettes. we will further bifocate this smoking population into income groups and consider which groups can afford premium cigarettes
exchanges.context: Provided his reasoning for applying the income filter since it was establised at step 0 by the interviewer to calculate for premium cigarettes.

exchanges.content: Alright.
exchanges.context: Shows his agreement since interviewwer establised the same at step 0

exchanges.content: I will bifurcate into 4 income groups that are below poverty line, lower middle class, upper middle class and upper class. with 20% , 40%, 30% and 10% respectively
exchanges.context: Segments the income filter establised in step 15 into four sub segments on the basis of their income with below povery line being the lowest and upper class being the highest

exchanges.content: Go on..
exchanges.context: Shows his agreement since the disctribution stated by the candiate is standard.

exchanges.content: And for the purpose of premium cigarettes i will be considering that only upper middle class and upper class would be able to afford those.
exchanges.context: Isolates highest and second highest income groups from the 4 sub sugments established in step 16 since they will be able to afford premium cigarettes

exchanges.content: Ok
exchanges.context: Shows his agreement since the logic is correct and the calcualtions are also correct.

exchanges.content: Upper middle class are 30% of 32 lakhs and upper class are 10% of 32 lakhs hence giving us a total of 13 lakhs approx
exchanges.context: Proceeds to narrow down the popuation calculated in step 14 into the two isolated sub segments establised in step 17 on the basis of their weightages and calculates the total

exchanges.content: Alright, go on
exchanges.context: Shows his agreement since the logic is correct and the calcualtions are also correct.

exchanges.content: Now 13 laks is the premium cigarette smoking population of delhi but since we have to calculate for tobacco ciggertes, we would further segment this popuation into categories of ciggertes they smoke.
exchanges.context: Proceeds to narrow down the population cacluated in step 18 on the basis of category of cigarette establied in step 0

exchanges.content: Ok
exchanges.context: Shows his agreement since the category was previously establised in step 0.

exchanges.content: Different categories would be tobacco and non-tobacco
exchanges.context: Proceeds to suggest two different sub segments for the category filter established in step 19

exchanges.content: Ok
exchanges.context: Shows his agreement since segmentation is logical.

exchanges.content: And for the purpose of this question we will be focusing on tobacco cigarettes as clarified earlier at the start
exchanges.context: Proceeds to isolate tobacco sub segment as established in step 0

exchanges.content: Alright go on.
exchanges.context: Shows his agreement since segmentation is logical.

exchanges.content: Since most of the people smoke tobacco ones i would be taking 60% of 13lakhs soking tobacco cigarettes. hence we get a toal of 8 lakh people smoking premium tobacco cigarettes in delhi
exchanges.context: Proceeds to narrow down the popuation established in step 18 accross the isolated sub segment establised in step step 21 on a logical weightage

exchanges.content: Alright, and this is where your approach will end?
exchanges.context: Shows his agreement and asks if this will be the last step of his approach because candiate calcuates for what he was asked for at the start.

exchanges.content: Yes
exchanges.context: Responds with a agreement

exchanges.content: Ok, thanks.
exchanges.context: Closes the interview.
